translation:
The undersigned Captain Roberto G. Bisley, Jerônimo Teixeira de Almeida, and Domingos José de Almeida, wishing to cooperate with all their strength in the prompt recognition of the Riograndense Republic, have agreed to arm at their own expense a barge to carry out privateering on the high seas in the waters of the Rio Grande harbor, against the vessels of the subjects of the Emperor of Brazil, taking from them, at the same time, all the advantages that can be gathered, and for such purposes mutually commit themselves to the conditions set forth in the following articles:

Article 1 — For the purchase of a barge that shall cruise in the waters of the Rio Grande harbor to harass the subjects of the Government of Brazil, its equipment, armament, and advances to the crew, each partner is obliged to deliver in Montevideo to partner Captain Roberto Bisley, or to whomever he appoints, the amount of 750 patacões in current coin.

Article 2 — The said partner Captain Roberto is responsible for the purchase of the aforementioned barge, its equipment and armament, as well as its command, the management of captures, and everything else related to privateering, in accordance with the Regulation of November 12, 1836, and other instructions received along with his letter patent from this Republic; and for the work of arming and equipping, he will demand nothing, but with respect to captures, as commander of the privateer, he shall have five percent in addition to the share that corresponds to him as the outfitter.

Article 3 — Partner Jerônimo is responsible for proceeding to Mostardas as soon as he receives notice of the purchase and departure of the privateer barge, to keep sentinels on the coast to observe where the capture runs aground, promote its unloading, dispose of the cargo effects, and maintain clear bookkeeping and notices to the other partners.

Article 4 — Partner Almeida is responsible for negotiating with the Government of the Republic the necessary orders and measures for the protection of the unloading of the captures, the sale of the goods contained therein, and the payment of those sold to the State, in addition to directing the notices to Montevideo.

Article 5 — All captures containing dry goods or war articles will be sent to Mostardas, to run aground at the contracted point; as for other captures, the commander will give the appropriate destination, sinking those that have no utility.

Article 6 — Half of the proceeds from the captures, once liquidated, shall be promptly delivered to the commander and captors.

Article 7 — The other half shall be delivered to the outfitters, who shall divide it into equal parts.

Article 8 — Partner Jerônimo is responsible for the effects of the captures he disposes of, and partner Captain Roberto equally for captures destined to other points, being obliged to give repeated notices.

And thus in agreement, they sign three copies of this content, so that each partner may keep his own.

City of Piratini, January 26, 1839.  
Domingos José de Almeida  
Roberto G. Bisley  
Jerônimo Teixeira de Almeida  

Society contract of a privateer.
